intro: Schoenoxiphium gracile, commonly known as the slender false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and thrives in partial shade. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Schoenoxiphium gracile is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
